definitions.example: That is so.  You are responsible for this, is that not so?

definitions.definition: In that state or manner; with that attribute. A proadjective that replaces the aforementioned adjective phrase.

definitions.example: It was so hot outside that all the plants died.  He was so good, they hired him on the spot.
I need a piece of cloth so long. [= this long]
Place the napkin on the table just so. If that's what you mean, then say so; (or do so).

definitions.definition: In the same manner or to the same extent as aforementioned; also.
definitions.example: Just as you have the right to your free speech, so I have the right to mine.  Many people say she's the world's greatest athlete, but I don't think so.  "I can count backwards from one hundred." "So can I."

definitions.definition: With as To such an extent or degree; as.
definitions.example: so far as;  so long as;  so much as
Eat your broccoli so you can have dessert.

definitions.definition: With the result that; for that reason; therefore.
definitions.example: He ate too much cake, so he fell ill.

definitions.definition: Provided that; on condition that, as long as.
Used after a pause for thought to introduce a new topic, question or story.

definitions.example: "You park your car in front of my house every morning." — "So?"

definitions.definition: Used to connect previous conversation or events to the following question.
definitions.example: So how does this story end?

definitions.definition: Used to introduce a rhetorical question.
definitions.example: We'd like to visit but I don't know if we can afford a hotel. —So who's staying in a hotel? Stay with us.

definitions.definition: Be as you are; stand still; used especially to cows; also used by sailors.
A syllable used in solfège to represent the fifth note of a major scale.
(foods) A type of dairy product, made especially in Japan between the seventh and 10th centuries, by reducing milk by boiling it.
